115232221.content:
Before I start, I want to clarify one thing. I will be setting this in an alternate timeline where Fairy Tail was never disbanded, but instead put on hiatus. After the one year, Makarov comes back and everything is normal. It works better for the story that I want to tell. With that off of my chest, on with the story!

"Sometimes, the woods can be peaceful. Other times, not so much." You said, lying on a small mat you use as a bed. "I have a strange feeling today is not going to be a peaceful day..."

"You said it, not me!" Johnny replied happily, a small fish tail sticking out of his mouth. "I just want to get to Magnolia already!"

"Soon Johnny." You assured your partner/best friend. "I just hope my feelings aren't justified. Anyway, I need some water for my pack. I'll be back in a bit!" You left Johnny at your campsite to walk over to a river. The water was crystal clear, and your reflection showed your somewhat disheveled face. It's been a week since you saw any kind of civilization, and you desperately wanted a place to stay. Camping in the woods had lost its merit after all the years. As you were reaching into the river to collect water for pack, you saw a couple of figures approaching. You could clearly see 5 people, all in their late twenties, running towards you. They did not seem of the friendly type either. "Huh. I guess I was right."

"HEY! WHAT ARE YOU DOING ON OUR TURF!" One of them, presumably the leader, yelled. "THESE WOODS ARE PROPERTY OF GHOST SHADOW!" You let them get closer so you can have a somewhat civilized conversation with them, despite your social anxiety. You can tell that these are the only people in the area, so Johnny is safe. Besides, you did teach him some offensive magic just in case you weren't there to defend him.

"Who is Ghost Shadow? Never heard of them." You said as they approached you.

"The dark guild that's going to beat you!" One yelled as he threw a punch directly at your face. You casually reached your hand up to block the punch, which startled the fighter. "Boss, he blocked my punch!"

"You're not very smart, are you?" You asked angrily. "All I want to do is pass through these woods on the public path. Last I checked, these woods are controlled by the Kingdom of Fiore. If you are not affiliated with them, you have no right to say you own these woods." As you finished, you returned a strong punch, knocking the attacker out instantly. "Is this your whole guild?"

"Yes. You have a problem with that?" The man you presumed to be the leader answered, somewhat timidly.

"I do actually." You replied angrily. "If you don't leave in the next five seconds, I will destroy your existence."

"Why should I listen to you? You may have beaten one of our guys, but you can't beat all four of us at once!" The leader yelled cockily. "Come on guys!" All four members charged at you, magic ready.

"This is going to be too easy." You muttered to yourself, as one of the attackers hit you in the side with a bolt of magic. It did not faze you at all. "You want to fight? Try attacking!" You taunted as you punched the ground. Doing so activated your best close range attack. "Explosion of the Water Dragon!" You yelled as a large sphere of scalding hot water surrounded your body, engulfing the entire guild. As soon as the water dissipated, you noticed you were surrounded by 5 unconscious men.

"Andy? Did I miss something?" Johnny asked out of nowhere.

"Sorry Johnny, I got into a bit of a scuffle." You smiled, showing off your large canine teeth. "No big deal. Let's get ready to go. I think Magnolia is close by!"


The next day...


"Johnny, could you fly up to see if you can see Magnolia?" You asked your best friend.

"Sure thing. Be right back!" He responded happily. As he was flying up, he collided with a strange blue object. Both Johnny and the blue thing fell down.

"Johnny! Are you okay?" You yelled, holding your friend in your arms.

"Yeah, I just hit something. Probably a bird." Johnny replied with a grin.

"Hey! What was that about!" Someone yelled. You turned to your side to see a blue cat-like animal. "Why did you hit me?"

"Another exceed?" You muttered in confusion. "Who are you?"

"I'm Happy!" Happy replied. "I just was trying to find some fish when he bumped into me!" Happy pointed at Johnny.

"Sorry, I was just trying to see if I could spot Magnolia. We're looking for a very important person!" Johnny said, trying to make amends.

"Who? I know a lot of people in Magnolia! I live there!" Happy replied happily.

"My dad's dying wish was for me to find Natsu Dragneel." You explained. "Do you know him?"

Before Happy could even answer, another person appeared. He seemed to be a muscular young man with reddish-pink spiky hair. "Happy! Is this where you fell?" He yelled.

"Aye!" He replied. "Natsu, I think this person wants to meet you!" Right as you heard Natsu's name, you fell on your knees and cried. "Hey? Are you okay?" Happy asked worriedly.

"Yes. I'm just happy." You answered crying.

"No, I'm Happy!" Happy interrupted with genuine anger.

"Happy, he means he feels happy!" Johnny corrected. "Andy's dad, Hydronis, said that Andy needed to find the guild Fairy Tail and meet Natsu!"

"Well, here he is!" Happy yelled as Natsu arrived at the site of the air collision. Immediately, Natsu approached you and asked if you were okay. You explained the whole story, including how Hydronis was your dragon dad, how he came out of your body, and his final wish. Eventually, you stopped crying and got to your feet.

"I can't believe I found you already!" You panted. "I'm just too happy."

"Well, that's good!" Natsu laughed. "Do you need a place to stay? I know some inns here!"

"That would be great!" You responded. "I was actually wondering if I could join Fairy Tail. That was also part of Hydronis's wish."

"Well, that's not up to me. You'll have to talk to Gramps about that." Natsu laughed. "Come on! I'll take you there!"

"But Natsu, fish!" Happy interjected worriedly. "We're out!"

"We can get some after we take this guy to the guild!" Natsu assured Happy. "By the way, who are you?"

"My name is Andrew Valencia. Most people call me Andy." You replied. "I'm a Water Dragon Slayer."

"And I'm Johnny, his best friend." Johnny interrupted.

"Anyway, my dad and your dad used to be good friends, but after they took us in, they grew distant. All my dad wants now is for us to make amends and be friends. What do you say?" You asked worriedly.

"Why wouldn't we be friends!" Natsu asked with genuine confusion.

"Well, fire and water are not known to pair well." You explained.

"Any friend on Igneel's is a friend of mine! Come on!" Natsu smiled. The four of you started running off to Magnolia, where the real adventure of your life will begin.

End of Chapter.

1152322211.content:
Before this begins, I would like to clarify something. This story that I am writing takes place in such a way that the time skip happens after Tartaros, and it is X792, but this story takes place instead of Avatar and Alvarez Empire. With that out of the way, enjoy!

The City of Magnolia. Your entire goal for one year was to reach this place and find Natsu Dragneel. Well congratulations, you managed to do both at the same time. Walking down the streets made you simultaneously feel nervous and excited. Interacting with people was never your strength, and the sheer amount of people in Magnolia almost gave you a panic attack. This is the first time you've been to a "big city". The farther you walked down the streets and the more you talked to Natsu, the more comfortable you felt. Eventually, you made it to an intersection. To your left, you could see Magnolia's pride and glory, Kardia Cathedral. To your right, you could make out a large building that said Fairy Tail on it. In front of you were just a couple of shops. Most notably a small, but historical bakery. (Watch Fairy Tail Zero). Obviously, you turned right. Using your keen vision, you spot the doors to the guild opening, and a blond teenage girl walking out. It looked like she had a whip and a small pouch attached at her waist, and a small purse around her shoulder. You thought nothing of it and continued forward to the guild.

Eventually, Natsu noticed the girl, and quickened his pace. "LUCY! THERE'S SOMEONE I WANT YOU TO MEET!" He hollered. By the end of this, he was at a full sprint. This caught you off guard, and you raced after him. Happy and Johnny didn't even bother trying to keep up. "Lucy. Meet Andy!"

"Hi Andy." The girl, presumably Lucy, said happily, presenting her hand for a handshake.

"Hi. I'm assuming your Lucy." You responded timidly, completing the hand shake. "Are you one of Natsu's friends?"

"Yeah. We go on jobs together a lot." Lucy smiled. "We never get anything out of them though. Natsu usually ends up destroying everything."

"I'M RIGHT HERE!" Natsu yelled angrily. "Besides, it's not my fault cities are so flammable."

"Well, I'm not going to be setting Hargeon on fire in the near future. I'm a Water Dragon Slayer." You joked, trying to ease the situation.

"I'm surprised your getting along with Natsu then." Lucy replied with a somewhat shocked expression on her face. "Considering how you get along with Gray..."

"It's because our dads were friends." Natsu interrupted.

"Really! That's so cool!" Lucy shouted.

"Jason rubbed off on you a bit, didn't he." Happy said out of nowhere. It seemed that the exceeds had arrived.

"Anyway, are you interested in joining Fairy Tail?" Lucy asked.

"Yeah. My dad asked me to. He kind of appeared out of my body and told me to find Natsu and join Fairy Tail. Weird right?" You explained.

"No. Not weird at all. Igneel came out of my body and fought Acnologia." Natsu's happiness went away. "It didn't end well for him."

"Moving on. If you're part of Fairy Tail, then you're a wizard." You deduced. "What kind of magic do you do?"

"I'm a celestial spirit mage!" Lucy replied happily.

"Really?" You became very interested. "I've always wanted to meet one. My dad, Hydronis, used to tell me bedtime stories about the celestial spirits. He said that if I was a good boy, I would get to meet them!"

"Well Andy, it seems that you've been good." Lucy smiled. She reached for the pouch and took out a golden key. "Gate of the Lion, I open Thee! Loke!" Immediately, a young man with orange spiky hair, blue tinted sunglasses and a suit appeared. "Andy, this is Loke, or Leo more formally." You were speechless. This was a goal of yours for much longer than making it to Magnolia.

"Are you okay?" Loke asked.

"Yeah. I've always wanted to meet a celestial spirit." You calmed yourself.

"Well here I am in the flesh!" Loke laughed.

"I think I'm going to need to stick around you Lucy." You smiled. "I can't wait to meet more!"

"Sometimes, we even go to the celestial spirit world." Lucy smiled. "The King refers to me as an "old friend"."

"Whoa." You said. You just stood there gawking.

"I think you just broke Andy." Johnny laughed. "Oh, I'm Johnny! Andy's best friend."

"And my new friend!" Happy interrupted.

"Well it's always good to make friends." Lucy said. "Anyway, I have to get something from my place. I'll be at the guild in a bit. Bye!"

"Bye Lucy. Bye Loke!" Natsu yelled as the two left. "Anyway, let's get you into Fairy Tail!" The four of you started walking towards the guild hall.


A few moments later...

"Here's Fairy Tail. Ready?" Natsu asked.

"Yes. I'm ready." You opened the doors and came across what looked like a large bar. There was a bar full of drinks, tables where people could sit and eat, and a large cork board with small papers on it.

"Hey everyone, I have a Fairy Tail hopeful!" Natsu yelled. Immediately, the room erupted in a roar of celebration. You could even hear a couple of girls comment on your looks. As the roar died down, a small old man started walking towards you.

"Natsu, why is it that new members always seem to be brought here by you?" The man asked.

"What's that supposed to mean?" He asked. "Oh Andy, this is the master."

"Hello." You said timidly. Your social anxiety seemed to be kicking in. "I'm Andrew Valencia. I'm a Water Dragon Slayer. And this is Johnny."

"We're very familiar with dragon slayers. You'll be number 5. And Johnny will be exceed number 4." The master said. "Oh, and I'm Makarov, the master."

"What should I call you?" You aksed. "Master, Makarov, what?"

"Whatever you feel comfortable with." He replied with a smile. "Anyway, what makes you want to join Fairy Tail."

"Well, my dad, Hydronis, said that I needed to become Natsu's friend to make amends with Igneel. He and Igneel were good friends, but grew distant over time. He wants to close that gap. He thought that the best way to become his friend is to join the same guild as him. Basically, my dad's dying wish was for me to join Fairy Tail." You explained.

"Well, there's no arguing with that one. Where do you want your guild mark, and in what color?" Makarov asked.

"Well, how about dark blue, like my hair." You replied. "And right here!" You pointed to your right shoulder. Makarov pointed his finger at your shoulder, and the Fairy Tail insignia appeared on your shoulder. "Wow! I'm in!" You almost started crying again.

"What about me?" Johnny asked.

"Well that depends. Where do you want yours?" Makarov asked.

"On my back, and in the same blue as Andy!" Johnny replied excitedly. Immediately, the guild mark appeared on Johnny's back.

"EVERYONE LISTEN UP!" Makarov yelled. The entire room went silent. "MEET THE TWO NEWEST MEMBERS OF FAIRY TAIL! ANDREW VALENCIA AND..." He paused. "What's your name?" He asked Johnny.

"Johnny." Johnny replied.

"JOHNNY!" Makarov finished. The room erupted in a loud roar. Everyone was yelling and cheering. People were coming up to you and introducing themselves to you. After person 20, you started to feel more comfortable, like the social anxiety was being drained out of you. Eventually one person introduced herself, and you broke.

"Hi! I'm Mirajane Strauss. Pleasure to meet you!" Mirajane smiled.

"Hi. I'm Andy. Pleasure to meet you too." You replied, very flustered. It seems that you now have a crush.

"You seem a little worked up." Mira stated. "You should come over and have a drink. That should loosen the tensions." You followed her over to the bar, where she made you a drink. "This one's on the house."

"Thanks." You smiled, taking the drink. "So, where does everybody live? Are there Fairy Tail apartments?"

"Yes!" She nodded. "Talk to the master about that one. So tell me about yourself."

Is she interested in me? You thought, panic stricken. You started looking around for Johnny. Eventually, you spotted him talking to the other exceeds. You decided to sit this one out. "Well, I'm a Water Dragon Slayer. I've basically spent my whole life wandering from town to town, trying to find fulfillment in life. The only constants were my magic and Johnny, my best friend." You responded.

"I did meet Johnny. He's so cute!" She said. "What made you join Fairy Tail?" You decided to tell the whole story about Hydronis and Igneel, your conversation with him last year, and your run-in with Natsu. "Neat. If you have any questions about the Guild, then just find me!" She smiled again. You were definitely in love.

"Well." You paused. "Thanks for the drink. I think I should get my room and board situation settled. It was nice talking to you!" You got up and headed over to the master. Unbeknownst to you, Mira had some interest in you. "Ummm... Master? What's the deal with where I live?"

"Well, there's Fairy Fields, the boy's dorms." He replied. "Would you like a room?"

"I don't see any other options for me at the moment..." You answered.

"Okay. The rent is 100,000 jewel per month. If you get good jobs, that shouldn't be too difficult." The master explained.

"Perfect. Johnny and I will do that." You smiled. It seemed as though your life was finally coming together.

End of Chapter

11523222111.content:
Finally, after what felt like hours of being social, you had some alone time. Even though you were feeling more comfortable as the time went on, enough was enough. Now, you have some peace and quiet, and a room all to yourself. No more sleeping on a mat in a tent. You finally had a place to call your own. The best way to describe your new home would be a studio apartment. There was one main room with a bed, a sofa, chairs and a table, a kitchenette and a closet. There was a small bathroom on the side as well. It was quite spacious, which comforted you. The confines of a tent were a thing of the past! As you put the backpack containing all of your belongings down, you made a sigh of relief. For some reason, your mind chose now to realize that you were an official member of Fairy Tail. The magnitude of this realization made you feel an odd combination of worry and relief. You worried that you wouldn't find your place in the guild, but simultaneously felt that you shouldn't be worrying. To ease your mind, you decided to take a shower. Your first one in quite some time.

Nothing calms you like the feeling of water on your skin. As a Water Dragon Slayer, this was your element. The shower refreshed you, and immediately made you think about how you would customize your room. You knew that you needed a bed for Johnny, who was waiting for you to finish your shower. After you dried off, you put on the only clean clothes you had, your usual vest, shorts and shoes. "You were in there for quite a while Andy!" Johnny laughed. "Contemplating?"

"You could say that." You smiled. "I was thinking about how we're really part of a guild!"

"What gave that away?" Johnny responded with snark, pointing at your guild mark.

"I don't mean like that!" You yelled. "There are a lot of responsibilities of a guild member. Plus, we need money..."

"Why don't we get a job!" Johnny suggested happily. "I saw a bunch on the cork board in the main guild building!"

"That's a good idea. Maybe we'll be able to get more clothes and stuff for the room!" You smiled.

"Or pay the rent..." Johnny muttered under his breath.

"Whatever. Let's get a job!" You yelled happily. You opened the door and were startled by what greeted you on the other side. It was Gray Fullbuster. "Hi Gray." You said, a bit flustered. While you were meeting people in the guild hall before, Gray was one of the people you bonded with the most.

"Hey Andy." He responded. "Could you keep the volume down a bit. You were being particularly loud just now."

"Sorry..." You said sincerely. "Wait, if you could hear me. Are we neighbors?"

"Yeah. Funny how that one worked out." Gray laughed. "Just keep it down. You were louder than Natsu, which is quite the accomplishment."

"Thanks." You laughed. "You know, I'm thinking about going on my first job now. Wanna come?"

"Yeah." Gray replied. "I can show you the ropes."

"Thank you!" You smiled a big, happy smile. You and Gray walked to the Guild Building together, Johnny following behind.


A few moments later...

"Okay. Reading job postings is simple. There's a description of the job on the slip, along with the reward. When you see a job you want, you bring it up to either the Master or Mira, who will take care of the rest. Then, you head out and do the job. Simple right?" Gray explained.

"Yeah. I guess." You said hesitantly. "You said Mira right?"

"Yeah... Why?" Gray asked confusedly.

"No reason." You quickly answered, trying to hide your feelings for Mira.

"Wow. You've been a member of the guild for only a couple of hours and you already have a crush." Gray laughed, poking fun at you.

"And?" You started. "What's wrong with that? Have you ever heard of 'Love at first sight'?"

"Yes. I'm all too familiar with it." Gray muttered. Immediately, a blue haired girl appeared behind you and Gray.

"Gray-sama! I'm back!" She yelled, completely ignoring you.

"Hi Juvia." Gray muttered. "Juvia, I'd like you to meet Andy Valencia. He's new to the guild."

"Oh. Hi. I'm Juvia Lockser." Juvia smiled with an outstretched arm.

"Well, you already know my name..." You said, completing the handshake.

"And I'm Johnny! Andy's best friend!" Johnny yelled out of nowhere.

"Oh! Hi! I didn't see you!" Juvia laughed. "Anyway Andy, what kind of magic do you do?"

"I'm a Water Dragon Slayer." You answered timidly, your social anxiety coming back.

"I also use water. How about that." Juvia laughed.

"Huh. That is interesting. I can't wait to see what you do with water!" You smiled, feeling more comfortable around the water mage.

"Same!" Juvia smiled. "Anyway. I MISSED YOU GRAY-SAMA!!!" She yelled, hurting the ears of everyone in the room.

"You were gone for one day!" Gray yelled back. "That should not be enough time to start missing someone!"

"Well it was!" Juvia yelled back.

"Whatever. I'm about to go on a job with Andy here. Show him the ropes." Gray said, trying to change the subject.

"Can I come? I can't stand to be away from you." Juvia begged.

"This specifically asks for two people." Gray answered, trying his hardest not to say no directly.

"I'll miss you Gray-sama." Juvia frowned, almost crying.

"Okay." Gray responded without emotion. "C'mon Andy." Gray started towards Mira, you and Johnny following. "Hey Mira. I'm taking Andy on his first job. Should be a quick one."

"Okay. You'll be going to Clover Town for this one. The train will leave in about 10 minutes. Have fun Andy!" Mira said.

"Thanks Mira." You responded nervously, blushing.

"Okay, we have no time to waist. Let's go!" Gray smiled, rushing out the door without his shirt.

"GRAY! YOUR SHIRT!" You yelled, holding his shirt.

"He has a problem with keeping clothes on." Mira laughed. "I'd suggest not questioning it."

"Thanks for the warning." You smiled, chasing after Gray.

"WAIT FOR ME!" Johnny yelled, running after you.

The train ride was the closest thing to torture you've ever experienced. Your dragon slayer motion sickness got the best of you, leaving you a queasy mess. "Well, at least you're not as bad as Natsu." Gray laughed. "He'd be one step from death right now."

"And he's not?" Johnny asked worriedly.

"No. This is normal for dragon slayers." Gray responded. "No idea why though."

"Will he be okay?" Johnny continued.

"Yeah. He'll be fine. Have you never rode in a carriage or anything before?" Gray asked.

"No. We've just wandered everywhere. We're not originally from Fiore. We came here once Andy's dad, Hydronis, told him to join Fairy Tail." Johnny explained.

"Why would he want Andy to join Fairy Tail?" Gray asked. Johnny then explained the story of Hydronis and Igneel, and Hydronis's dying wish. "Wow." Gray responded surprised.

"Yeah. Deep." Johnny responded. "Are we almost there?"

"Should be." Gray answered.

"NEXT STOP, CLOVER TOWN!" The voice on the train boomed.

"There, next stop." Gray smiled.

"Thank God!" Johnny said, relieved.

Ten minutes later, the torture finished. With help from Johnny and Gray, you disembarked the train, and proceeded to your job. Once you got to the address on the job, you were greeted by the client. His name was Eric Idleson, an aristocrat living in Clover. You must be Mr. Idleson." Gray started.

"And you must be the Fairy Tail wizards who took on my request." He replied.

"We are." Gray responded. "What do you need us to do?"

"Well, there have been reports of some Gorians in the forests. We were hoping that you could deal with them." Eric explained. "Also, please try not to destroy the forest again. We had enough problems rebuilding after Lullaby."

"Okay. Natsu and Erza aren't here, so that shouldn't be an issue." Gray laughed.

"Okay. But still try." Eric demanded. "Damage the forest, no reward."

"Okay. Andy, Johnny, let's go." Gray said. As you left the house, Gray started to look worried.

"What's wrong Gray?" You asked.

"You don't talk much. Do you?" Gray asked.

"Well, um..." You hesitated.

"Johnny's not good around new people. We're working on it though." Johnny explained.

"Yeah." You confirmed.

"Well, if you want to do jobs well, you're gonna need some better communication skills." Gray said sternly. "Anyway, let's beat up some Gorians."

"That I can get behind." You smiled. "I've been attacked by a lot in my travels. They never stood a chance."

"Well that's good to hear." Gray smiled. "Can't stand those things either." The three of you continued talking as you walked into the forest, looking for Gorians to beat up.


End of Chapter
11523222111.title: Jobs

115232221111.content:
After a ten minute walk, you could see something in the distance. Sure enough, it was a Gorian. You've encountered many of these things during your travels, and each one was easier than the last. After all, you got stronger over time, and they didn't. "Gray. I see one." You said, smiling. "I haven't fought one of these in a while. Should be fun."

"Fun? These things are more annoying than fun." Gray quibbled. "Easy, but annoying."

"They've never lasted long enough with me to be annoying." You snickered. "Just watch." You could see the Gorian approaching you at quite quickly. You simply pointed your hand towards it like you were telling it to stop. "Beam of the Water Dragon." You said at your normal talking volume. Instantly, a magic circle appeared in front of your hand, from which a narrow, but strong beam of water shot. The beam collided with the Gorian's chest, causing the large green ape-like creature to fly up and into a mountain several hundred yards away. You could tell it was dead. "See what I mean?" You asked Gray, who was awestruck from the attack.

"I don't think I've ever seen one go down so quickly." Gray said, dumbfounded.

"Andy is really really strong!" Johnny yelled, smiling.

"I might have killed it though..." You smirked. "Oops."

"Well, one less Gorian in the world won't hurt, will it?" Gray said, shrugging it off.

"No it won't!" Johnny smiled. "Hate those things."

"Yeah." You agreed. "I've battled more Gorians than I can count. It's what happens when you used to live in forests. Camping 24/7."

"Anyway, let's let the next one approach so we can get some information. Gorians love talking." Gray started. "Your attack made Natsu seem patient."

"I'm guessing that's not good." You laughed.

"No. It's not." Gray laughed. As this short conversation finished, 3 more Gorians appeared, startling the three of you.

"OOH! LOOK!" One of the Gorians yelled. "PEOPLE TO TAKE OVER!"

"You're not supposed to say it outright!" The middle Gorian chided. "They're not supposed to know."

"Oops. Sorry." The first Gorian muttered.

"So, while you two are fighting, can I ask you a question?" Gray demanded.

"Whataya want?" The middle Gorian sneered.

"How many Gorians are here in this forest?" You demanded. "Or better, how many do I have to defeat?"

"Just the three of us and one more." The middle Gorian answered.

"So three." You smiled. "One's already fallen by my hand."

"You've already attacked? How could you!" The third Gorian yelled, starting to cry.

"Well, it was charging toward us." You smiled cockily. "And you're next." You rushed up to the Gorian and punched it directly in the stomach. It immediately curled up and fell limp on the ground. "Don't worry! I didn't kill this one!" You laughed. "Your turn Gray!"

"Ice-Make Lance!" Gray shouted, extending his arms forward. A large barrage of pointed lances of Ice shot from his hands, impacting the other two Gorians. When the barrage was over, the two Gorians were unconscious. "Andy, here in Fairy Tail, we try our hardest not to kill."

"Sorry, my Beam attack sometimes goes a bit overboard." You laughed, apologizing.

"It's fine. Let's just get these things out and get our reward." Gray said, picking up one of the Gorians. You could only pick up one, and you knew Johnny couldn't carry one. Not knowing what you do, you used your magic to launch the last one into the mountains when Gray wasn't looking.

"Okay, got this one. Let's go!" You said, ignoring the fact that you sent the other Gorian flying.

"What about the third one?" Gray asked, turning around to see the last one missing.

"Uh.... I made it go away. It should be fine." You laughed nervously.

"I'm just gonna pretend that didn't happen." Gray sighed. "You're like a watery version of Natsu. Using your brawn before your brain."

"If someone's willing to teach me a more strategic way to do things, I would." You laughed, trying to make some light in the situation.

"You want strategy, find the First Master. Sometimes she appears." Gray laughed. "Anyway, let's get our reward."

The walk back was particularly uninteresting. Aside from the two unconscious Gorians on your back occasionally moving, nothing happened. After a while, you made it to the town, where the reward was waiting. you told Eric that you'd gotten rid of the Gorians with only a couple of trees retaining minor damages. He was impressed, and paid each of you 200,000 Jewel. This was more money than you'd ever had at one time. Needless to say, you were excited to get back. You deposited the Gorians somewhere they would not be any trouble for the people of Clover, and headed back to Magnolia. While you were in town, you bought some new clothes, some decor for your apartment, and a small bed for Johnny. After your shopping spree, you still had about 30,000 Jewel left. The master said that your first payment would be at the end of the month. You still had 23 days to get 170,000 Jewel. If every job was as easy and lucrative as the last one, you should have no problem making enough.

After putting away all of your stuff, you went back to the guild hall. It was nighttime now, so not many people were there. The only people who were there were Natsu, Happy, Lucy, Erza, Gray, Wendy, Carla, the Master and Mira. The Master looked to be talking to everyone while Mira was closing up the bar. "Andy! Johnny! How was your first Job?" Mira asked from across the room.

"It went well. Thanks for asking!" You answered, approaching the bar. As you got closer, the blushing in your cheeks became more prominent. "How was your day?"

"It was good!" Mira responded smiling. "Same as any other day."

"What do you do all day?" You asked curiously.

"Well, I work the bar, serve and make food. That kind of stuff." Mira started. "Whenever there's an emergency though, I fight. I might not look it, but I'm one of the strongest mages in Fairy Tail!"

"Really?" You asked, smiling. "What do you do?"

"Take Over with different demons. I'm a really different person when using my magic." Mira replied. "They're really strong."

"I can't wait to see them in action!" You said excitedly. "Living alone, aside from Johnny, all my life has made me very curious and excited to see new magic."

"Well, hope you'll never be in a place where you'll need to see my magic." Mira laughed.

"Yeah, if it's for emergencies only." Your smile died down a bit. "What's going on over there?"

"Oh. the Master is giving them a mission. It's supposed to be secret." Mira answered.

"Then I guess I shouldn't be here." You laughed. "I'll go. It was nice talking to you Mira!"

"You too Andy!" Mira said, smiling. You really were not sure what to do to further your relationship, because you wanted to. You've never felt the way you do near Mira before, and you like it. Maybe you'll ask her out on a date soon. Who knows? As you and Johnny were leaving the guild hall, you felt a tap on your shoulder. You turned around and saw Happy flying behind you.

"Andy! Gramps told me to get you!" Happy smiled happily.

"Why would he want me?" You asked confusedly.

"I don't know!" Happy yelled. You and Johnny turned around and entered the group of people.

"Andy. Johnny. Now that you're here, I would like to explain what is happening." The Master said, taking a piece of paper out of his coat. He unrolled it on a table, revealing a map of Crocus. "There have been rumors of some suspicious activity going on in Crocus. We got a request directly from Princess Hisui to sort it out. Not much is known about it. For some reason, Hisui requested you guys specifically."

"How do I fit into this?" You asked. "I doubt she asked for me."

"Well, she didn't. Gray did." The Master replied.

"After seeing what you did in the forest, I thought that you'd work in our group's dynamic." Gray explained.

"Plus, we need someone to put out the inevitable flames." Erza said, looking at Natsu.

"Hey!" Natsu yelled.

"WHAT?" Erza yelled, frightning Natsu.

"Anyway, we want to make sure everything is okay in Crocus, and make sure the Royal Family is safe." The Master finished. "Understand?"

"Yes." Everyone said almost in unison.

"You'll leave tomorrow. I hope everything goes well." The Master added. After that, everyone dispersed, going to their various residences. As you were walking out, you felt another pat on the shoulder. This time it was Mira.

"Looks like you're part of a team now." She smiled. "And that one of all teams."

"What do you mean?" You asked.

"They're notorious for their..." She paused. "Destructive nature."

"Well, I guess I can help." You laughed. "Water does help keep the fires down."

"Yeah." Mira smiled. "I was wondering if you wanted to go out? Celebrate your joining Fairy Tail and your first mission." You were screaming with joy inside. You couldn't believe this was happening.

"Yeah! I'd love to!" You replied excitedly.

"I'll meet you in the apartment." Johnny yawned. "I'm going to sleep."

"See ya there!" You said happily. Mira was asking you out!

"I know a good place. Let's go!" Mira suggested, grabbing your arm and heading towards the location of your date.


End of Chapter
115232221111.title: One Sided Battles

choices: Skip to starting the journey to Crocus
1152322211112.content:
Quick Ret-Con... I'm changing Andrew's age to 20. Same age as Sting, Rogue and Mira. I also never mentioned that your eyes are a seafoam green

Mira basically dragged you to Yajima's restaurant in Magnolia, 8-Island. It was a nice looking restaurant, albeit a bit small. You were excited though. You were out with Mirajane Strauss! You were having a hard time keeping your composure, especially because Johnny wasn't there to keep your mind balanced. You were, for now, functional. As you walked in, you were immediately greeted by a short man wearing a large chef's hat. "Hi Yajima-san!" Mira happily said to the man. "I want you to meet the newest member of Fairy Tail!"

"Well then, how do you do?" Yajima answered. "I'm Yajima. I used to be a member of the Magic Council and Fairy Tail, but those days are long gone."

"I'm Andrew Valencia." You stammered timidly. "But most people call me Andy."

"Don't worry about him." Mira smiled. "He's a bit shy."

"I see." Yajima nodded. "Well, would you two like a table?"

"That would be lovely!" Mira smile continued. "By the way, the renovations are great. I'm glad you were able to rebuild after last year."

"What happened last year?" You asked quietly.

"Well." Yajima sighed. "Are you familiar with Tartaros?"

"I'm not sure. I think my dad mentioned it last year." You started. "My dad is, er.. was a dragon. Hydronis, King of the Water Dragons."

"Well, he probably helped stopped Face from going off." Yajima started. "Last year, Tartaros tried to activate a weapon called Face. If it went off, it would destroy all magic on the entire continent. To activate it, they tried to kill every current and former member of the Magic Council. Me included. They destroyed this place, and almost got me. Thankfully, the Raijinshuu (Thunder God Tribe) were here and saved me. Since then, I've been slowly rebuilding this place. Now it's back open!"

"Did you have to fight during this?" You asked Mira, knowing from your walk that she doesn't like to fight.

"Yeah. But I was in my element." Mira answered. "Tartaros was populated by demons from the Books of Zeref. I have demon particles in my blood, hence my magic. It was a fitting fight."

"I wish I could have helped." You sighed.

"Your dad did though. You should be proud of that at least." Yajima said, trying to cheer you up a bit.

"Yeah. At least he did that." You started to smile. "Let's just sit and eat."

"That's why we came here!" Mira smiled. Yajima handed you and Mira menus. As you were looking through the choices, you notice that they were a bit out of budget for you.

"I'm not sure if I'm going to get much. I'm low on cash." You said with your head buried in the menu.

"It's okay! I'll pay!" Mira smiled. "I'm sure you spent a lot on stuff after your job. You needed stuff, right?"

"Yeah. I did want to have more than 3 shirts." You and Mira laughed and talked for a while, before ordering your food. You decided to get the Beast Man Curry, seeing how you like spicy food. Mira got the Blue Sky Bolognese, something you were thinking of getting.

"I don't think I've told you this Andy." Mira smiled. "This restaurant specializes in preparing food with magic."

"Really!" Your magic curiosity senses were tingling. "Is there a way to see it?"

"Yeah! There's a window into the kitchen to watch the food being prepared." Mira laughed.

"Can I look for a bit?" You asked, seeing how you didn't want to interrupt your date.

"Of course. I need to go to the bathroom. I'll see you in a bit." She said, getting up to leave. You darted over to the window, where you saw different ingredients floating around. There was a pot of soup being heated up with fire magic, onions being chopped without knifes, and so much more. It was almost like heaven for you.

After a few minutes, you heard a door open. Assuming it was Mira, you started to walk back to the table. However, it wasn't. Instead, it was the front door opening to let someone in. He was a mysterious looking man, wearing dark robes and keeping his face shrouded. You had a bad feeling about this guy, but you did not instigate anything. You just hoped he was another patron. Mira came back from the bathroom as you sat down. She too, saw the man in the robes, and had the same feeling about him. "I just hope this restaurant doesn't get destroyed again." Mira muttered. You saw the man standing and waiting at the host's stand. It looked as though he was waiting for a table. After a minute, Yajima came out of the kitchen and greeted the man.

"Hello! Welcome to 8-Island! Would you like a table?" Yajima said happily, though it sounded forced. The man nodded, saying nothing. "How many?" The man held up one finger. "One? I have a table right here." Yajima walked the man over to a table 2 tables away from you and Mira, where he sat down and took a menu. You felt very uneasy. You couldn't put your finger on why, but you just knew something bad was about to happen.

10 minutes passed before your food came. A large bowl of curry was put in front of you, which you tried to eat in a civilized manner. However, you were very hungry, so you still ate quite quickly. Meanwhile, Mira calmly ate her bolognese. The two of you continued talking. Mira told you about the history of Fairy Tail, and how Mavis has been showing up a lot recently. You hoped that you could meet her. Maybe learn how to be strategic from the Fairy Tactician. As you and Mira were finishing and getting ready to go, you noticed the man get up. You thought this was fishy. As you and Mira left, you noticed the man following you. He continued following you until you made it to a park near the Fairy Tail building. You looked behind you and saw the man. You stopped, making the man stop as well. "Who are you? And why are you following us?" You demanded. You got no answer.

"Sir? Why are you following us?" Mira asked much more calmly. Still no answer. You were feeling very confused and worried.

"Shield of the Water Dragon!" You yelled, waving your hand in an arching manner. Immediately, a bubble of water surrounded you and Mira. "A precaution." You were right to do that. After seeing this, the man attacked with a strong blast of fire. Thankfully, the bubble stopped it. You took action and shot a beam of water at him, knocking him back. Other than that , he was not very fazed by the attack. However, the attack did knock the hood off of his head. Oddly, it was Natsu!

"Natsu?" Mira asked. "What are you doing?"

"I wanted to see how strong Andy was. Considering how Gray described it, it got my curious!" Natsu explained.

"If you wanted to fight, then you could have just asked!" You yelled. "You didn't have to stalk us!"

"Well.. I was also wondering what you and Mira were doing." Natsu laughed. Hearing this, you took a small bit of water in your hand, and made it into a whip, slapping Natsu in the face.

"Well, if you must know. Mira took me out to celebrate my joining Fairy Tail." You explained angrily. "Now, if you don't mind, I want to go back home and go to sleep. It's been a long night. If you want to fight me, then let's do it later. Now, I'm not feeling it." You finished with a yawn, dispelling the bubble. Mira watched this whole thing laughing.

"That is a very Natsu thing to do." She laughed. "Although this one was pushing it. Don't worry, he means well." She smiled as she grabbed your hand. You finished the walk back to your apartment holding hands like a real couple.

By the time you got back to your apartment, it was nighttime. You were hoping you'd get a lot of sleep tonight, but you felt this more than made up for the sleep you were not getting. As Mira was saying good night to you, you froze up. "Andy, what's going on?"

"Mira. I think I need to just come out and say it." You started. "First of all, tonight was amazing, even after the Natsu thing. Second, ever since I walked into the guild hall the first time, I.. I.." You tried to finish, but you couldn't say it.

"You had a crush on me?" Mira finished your sentence. You just nodded, embarrassed. "Honestly, the same can be said with me. When I saw you, I thought you'd be the one."

"Really?" You asked in disbelief. "So I had a crush on you and you had a crush on me?" She nodded. "So, does that mean that tonight wasn't a celebration as much as it was a date?"

"Sure!" Mira smiled. "I took you out on a date!"

"Wow. One day of being a Fairy Tail mage and I'm already in a relationship. This is awesome." You smiled happily. "Thanks for the awesome night Mira!"

"You too Andy!" She responded, initiating a hug. You and her hugged for a solid minute before briefly kissing and going your separate ways. This was a day you were never going to forget. You made it up to your room, where you noticed Johnny sleeping in his new bed. You quietly got ready to sleep, and passed out on your bed, excited for what's to come.


End of Chapter
1152322211112.title: An Eventful Date

choices: You investigate near the shopping district with Natsu
You investigate near the shopping district with Gray
11523222111121.content:
"Wake up sleepyhead!" Johnny yelled at you, jumping on your stomach. "Any longer and you'll miss the train to Crocus!" You slowly opened your eyes, and was greeted to your apartment. You were happy that yesterday wasn't a dream, because it seemed too good to be true. You were also thankful that your dream didn't come true. Your dream, or nightmare in this case, was that Fairy Tail was abolished, and you were on your own again. Like that could ever happen. You smiled as you sat up in your bed. When you slept, you usually just wore some sleeping pants, so your muscular, toned torso was on full display. As you rubbed your 8-pack, stomach growling, you got up to shower. There should be no reason for me, the author, to tell you why you love to shower. You loved the feeling of water cleaning you. It felt amazing.

After a much longer shower than necessary, you got dressed, ate some quick breakfast that you hoped wouldn't be lost on the train, and left to go to the guild hall. It was the same as when you first arrived. Everyone was either eating, drinking, talking, or looking for jobs. You could see your group sitting at a table eating. You rushed over to them, joining them at the table. "Okay, we're only waiting for Natsu and Happy now." Erza started. "Figures they'd be late."

"Hey guys!" Johnny yelled happily, trying to get over the noise of the guild hall.

"Hey Johnny! Hey Andy!" Wendy yelled, smiling. "How was your dinner with Mira?"

"It was great!" You smiled. "It turned into a bit more than a dinner though.." You looked over to the bar, where she was pouring drinks. She noticed and smiled towards you. You blushed as you turned your head back to the group. "Her and I both had a crush on each other, and last night, it became a real relationship. Less than 24 hours as a Fairy Tail Mage and I already have a girlfriend! I've never been happier!"

"And it's Mira too." Gray added. "That's impressive. People have been trying to get with her for years."

"Well, people have always said that I'm attractive." You chuckled somewhat coyly.

"Well they're not wrong." Lucy laughed.

"If you children are done, we have planning to do." Erza interrupted, shutting everyone up. You could tell that she's the only reason why anything gets done in this group. "Once Natsu and Happy get here, we need to hurry to the train to get to Crocus."

"Is there any way to get there that doesn't involve trains? My last one didn't go well." You muttered.

"Only if you want to walk." Erza answered sternly.

"Nevermind." You sighed, lowering your head.

"I'd say first we talk to Hisui to get the whole scoop." Lucy suggested.

"Good idea Lucy." Gray interrupted. "We should also find a place to stay in Crocus."

"I'm sure Hisui will take care of that." Lucy smiled. "Remember how she pardoned us after Natsu did his little stunt?"

"Yes." Carla sighed. "We really need to make that one up to her."

"What did Natsu do?" You asked.

"Well..." Carla started.

"He almost destroyed the arena for the Grand Magic Games." Wendy interrupted.

"She must really like you guys." Johnny laughed.

"Well, we did stop a flood of dragons from destroying the world." Gray smirked.

"Yeah. All of the guilds helped with that one." Erza butted in. "There's a lot to the story. I'll tell you later."

"Thanks Erza." You smiled. Another minute of banter and planning went by before Natsu and Happy arrived. As soon as they got there, everyone got up and headed to the train station. Erza, Gray, Lucy, Happy, Johnny and Carla all talked about what the group would do in Crocus on the train while you, Natsu and Wendy were all trying not to throw up. Gray was right when he said it was a dragon slayer thing. Eventually, the motion-sickness torture was over, and you arrived in Crocus. You thought Magnolia was big until you saw Crocus. It was huge. You'd never seen anything like it. There were buildings everywhere. As you and Johnny gawked at the vastness of the city, everyone else headed towards the palace. You were dragged there by Erza. The palace was huge as well. You felt so small compared to this place. Eventually, you made it to the throne room, where a young woman with green hair was sitting. She was in very fancy clothing. You could tell that she was the princess. As your group approached, she got up and walked towards you.

"Fairy Tail. We've been having troubles here." Hisui started. He immediately stopped when she noticed you. "Who's he?"

"That's Andy. He's new to Fairy Tail, and joined our team. He'll be useful, believe me!" Lucy smiled. You whispered 'Thank You' under your breath.

"Anyway, there's been a series of crimes committed here. Every squadron of soldiers sent to investigate has come back saying that they couldn't handle it. Seeing how you're much stronger than any of those guys, I want you to investigate these crimes." She explained.

"Consider it done Princess!" Natsu yelled.

"I've arranged rooms for you at an inn in town. It's a very nice place." Hisui smiled. "It would be a bit of a liability for me to keep you guys in the palace."

"Thank you Princess." Wendy said, bowing her head.

"Is there anything we need to know about these crimes?" Gray asked.

"They've all been robberies of magic shops. Mostly lacrimas have been stolen." Hisui replied.

"Thank you Princess. Let's go!" Erza yelled, leaving the throne room. Everyone, including you, followed her.

"I'm counting on you Fairy Tail!" Hisui yelled to you as you left. A guard gave you a slip of paper with the address for the inn on it as you left the palace. When you got to the inn, you learned that you were rooming with Gray, your current closest friend in the guild. After putting your stuff down, everyone regrouped, decided where they would look and with who, and split up.


End of Chapter

1153.content:
How about you become one with Requip magic, in one of these forms.

Knight form: Allows user to store weapons and armors in pocket dimensions and summon them during battle. This gives the user a high level of offense, defense, flexibility and variety in combat, regarding the type of the armor and/or weapon they Requip.
